author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of Tamil Nadu Primary Cooperative Bank Employees’ Association staging a demonstration in Tirunelveli on Monday.— Photo: A. Shaikmohideen

Members of the Tamil Nadu Primary Cooperative Bank Employees’ Association, who began indefinite strike on Monday, staged a demonstration at Vannarpet here to highlight their demand.

Besides giving pension to them, those who retired from service should be given ex-gratia. The agitation was led by State general secretary K. Muthupandian.

Thoothukudi

M. Jesurajan, district secretary, who led the agitation, said 1,300 employees from 154 cooperative societies and 540 fair price shops joined the strike in the district.
title: Coop. bank staff begin indefinite strike
